oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On Modeling and Estimation for the Relative Risk and Risk Difference
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Richardson, Thomas S.
Robins, James M.
Wang, Linbo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Statistics - Methodology
Statistics - Applications
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A common problem in formulating models for the relative risk and risk difference is the variation dependence between these parameters and the baseline risk, which is a nuisance model. We address this problem by proposing the conditional log odds-product as a preferred nuisance model. This novel nuisance model facilitates maximum-likelihood estimation, but also permits doubly-robust estimation for the parameters of interest. Our approach is illustrated via simulations and a data analysis.
